verse.name: v1
verse.lines: ‘Twas Jesus, my Saviour, who died on the tree, To open a fountain for sinners like me; His blood is that fountain which pardon bestows, And cleanses the foulest wherever it flows.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: For the lion of Judah shall break every chain, And give us the vict’ry, again and again.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: And when I was willing with all things to part, He gave me His blessing, His love in my heart; So now I am joined with the conquering band Who are marching to glory at Jesus’ command.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Though round me the storms of adversity roll, And the waves of destruction encompass my soul; In vain this frail vessel the tempest shall toss— My hope is secure through the blood of the cross.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: And when with the ransomed, by Jesus, my Head, From fountain to fountain I then shall be led; I’ll fall at His feet and His mercy adore, And sing Hallelujah to God evermore.
